name: Leonardo House
description:
Leonardo House is located in the downtown of Florence which allows an easy access to all the touristic attractions.
Our rooms are ideal for the guests who appreciate clean rooms and peaceful nights, without traffic disturbing in the night.
neighborhood_overview:
Our street is 10 meters from Via Tornabuoni, the most famous street in Florence with high fashion shops and lovely pedestrian walking area. All famous events in our city cross this street, in summer time you can hear best street artist playing lovely italian music, during all year few times you can see the traditional medieval parades and in Christmas period is full with magic lights.
All this events doesn't disturb as our street is very quite special in the evening and is also the best way from the main train station to the Duomo avoiding massive group of people.
host_about:
Florence as many other tourist cities are full with history and secret places what people can not find in every guide. Working in the hotels and tourist structures have good experience to show you most immportant places and how to save more time...and money of corse. 
Been in this job had oportunity to meet many people from all the world, many caracters, cultures and to be honest, everyone deserve to be respected. Addore nice and respectible people with sense of humor, feel good to serve to my guests and explain evetything what they need, all what you need is to ask.

name: MAGDA: next to the DUOMO , 2 rooms, lift
description: A spacious apartment , close to the Duomo, that can host 4 to 6 persons. 2 double bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, living/dining, kitchen, 2 extra beddings in a balcony loft- linen not included: 20€/person/change for sheets and towels ( not obligatory, you can use your own)- Utilities not included- you pay for what you use ( meters read). Extras_ wi-fi 30€/month, rubbish tax 15€/month. Final cleaning 100€. Deposit required.
neighborhood_overview: this area is interesting because totally central, yet not extremely touristy-any major attraction is within easy walking distance-  It was what is now called the "Medici quarter": that's why you have all their important heirloom so close ( Palazzo Medici, S.Marco, Ospedale degli Innocenti, S.Lorenzo and the Medici chapels...)- also, for those interested in architecture, it is on the "Brunelleschi itinerary", connecting the Duomo to Ospedale degli Innocenti to S.Lorenzo ( all masterpieces by Brunelleschi)-
host_about:
Magda e Massimo  Carli architects from Viareggio, Tuscany, Italy.
(Viareggio is a very nice seaside resort on  the Tyrrhenian coast..- Viareggio is very famous for its Carvival and its lovely sandy beaches.)
Through the years we  acquired a certain number of properties ( in Florence, Venice, Tuscan seaside-countryside, Ligurian countryside, lake Como),which we enjoyed renovating very much.They were all selected as vaction rentals- so we had an eye for location , character, comfort...hope we succeded creating lovely spaces and homes where the tourist actualluìy feels being in Italy and in that particular place.
So the colours we used are different in Florence than in Venice, the town apartments have a totally different atmosphere from the seaside/countryside houses.
We enjoy meeting our guests and giving them info about the area, and indicating unusual sights, local eateries, things that do not feature on the guidebooks. They normally appreciate that, and we often make friends.

There is a small suprmarket called Coop at walking distance which is quite cheap and product are very good quality.
host_about:
Vivo da sola con mia figlia, ma mi piace molto avere amici e gente intorno. Amo condividere i miei spazi, le mie idee...trovo ogni scambio assolutamente arricchente!
Mi piace leggere, viaggiare e conoscere tutto ciò che è possibile su culture diverse dalla mia...credo che questa sia la vera trasmissione del sapere...Per questo ho studiato lingue e soggiornato all'estero quanto più possibile.

Per favore contattatemi via email

name: Charming singleroom XIX century apt
description:
This room is suitable for a person that would like to enjoy Florence sharing a fully equipped house where restore after his/her tours and where to solve any (even small) need might have. Any tool or facility you can miss is there, just on request.

Sunny 150sqft single room with wardrobe, desk, marble floor, frescoed ceiling, wireless internet connection, TV set. The bathroom is shared.
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is in the XIX century portion of Florence, with beautiful building of that period and Liberty style, 800sqft.
Streets around are large and confortable, Piazza Savonarola and D'Azeglio are wonderfull squares, located very close.
host_about:
Professionista di 55 anni, formatore e consulente aziendale. Ho una figlia ventenne, lavoro a Firenze, città che conosco e amo. Dipingo, mi diverto in cucina, faccio immersioni sub. La mia compagna vive a Firenze e condivide molti dei miei interessi. Mi piace il rapporto che si viene a creare con i miei ospiti. Loro sono molto curiosi di Firenze e io amo molto questa città, mi piace raccontarla e mi piace dare l'opportunità di cogliere nel breve tempo della vacanza le bellezze, i significati, le vicende. Mi piace aiutare ad utilizzare bene il tempo, senza sprecarlo in code e attese. 
I like my work, training to adult people, traveling, painting and read about history and phisics. 
I need to cook what  I eat, to enjoy staing with my daughter, to challange myself in jogging. Last book I read: The history of (almost) everything. 
Last film: In me non c'è che futuro, about Adriano Olivetti life and operas
Most preferred music: Messa di requiem in Re min by Mozart.


I like the good feeling that often arises with my guests. They are very curious to Florence and I really love this city, I like to tell it, and I like to give the opportunity to seize in the short time the beauties , the meanings, the story. I like to help to use the time well without wasting it in code and waited.

name: Residenza Oltrarno Guest House
description:
Residenza Oltrarno is a 200 square metres flat on the first floor of a nice '30 building, which can contain ten people up.
It consists of a great central entrance with hallway, 3 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, 1 kitchen/dining room, 1 double living room and 4 balconies.
Air-conditioning/heating and Internet Wi-Fi are free.
neighborhood_overview:
Residenza Oltrarno is located in San Frediano neighborhood which is one of the ancient districts of Florence.
Walking around this neighborhood You will breathe the air and You will live the spirit of one of the oldest areas of the city of Florence.
The San Frediano neighborhood is also known for the novel book (which one was made also a movie) of Vasco Pratolini, famous Florentine writer, entitled "The girls of San Frediano" (1952).
host_about:
Residenza Oltrarno di Firenze: una bella casa in una bellissima città.
Residenza Oltrarno in Florence: a beautiful house in a beautiful city.

name: A charming house in Oltrarno
description: The apartment is located in a historic building in the bohemian district of Santo Spirito, where you can still breathe the atmosphere of the real Florence. On foot you can easily reach all the most representative places of the city.
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is in a historic building in the bohemian district of Santo Spirito—an area bustling with the real atmosphere of Florence. Tasty local restaurants, charming cafe's and the city's iconic locations are all within walking distance.
host_about:
Sono architetto vivo e lavoro in Toscana da oltre 30 anni. Do una mano al mio compagno Francesco, che è il proprietario dell'appartamento e non conosce l'inglese, a  gestire il sito. Amo molto la città di Firenze, che considero la mia città anche se non ci sono nata.   Mi piacerebbe che anche i nostri ospiti potessero apprezzare Firenze in maniera più genuina di quanto normalmente un turista possa fare.
I am an architect living and working in Tuscany for over 30 years. I help my partner Francesco, who is the owner of the apartment and don't speak english, to manage the site. I love the city of Florence, which I consider my home town even though I was born. I would like my guests  to  enjoy Florence a more genuine than is normally a tourist can do ..

name: Apartment in the heart of Firenze
neighborhood_overview:
The palace is located in the historic center of Florence, on a parallel to Via Tornabuoni, the main shopping street; the Cappelle Medicee, San Lorenzo, Piazza della Repubblica, Via Roma, Via Dei Calzaioli, the Duomo, Ponte Vecchio, Piazza della Signoria, the Uffizi Gallery and Santa Croce are easily reachable on foot. In the immediate vicinity there are numerous typical Tuscan trattorias (one is right below the house), bar with tobacco shop, a bakery, a butcher shop, a rotisserie, grocery stores and a laundry (for further recommended points of interest nearby, see the GUIDE button, in the top right!).
The area is limited traffic but cars can be parked in one of the paid garages nearby.
Piazza Santa Maria Novella, where the train station, the tram terminal and the many bus stops are located, is 600 minutes away, so, given the proximity, you can easily visit other areas of the city and the region.
host_about: Finally graduated, I love travel, see, take film pictures and develop them (find Pumobelix on Flickr); my iPod classic is a part of me. Airbnb is a great experience, in which I'm really happy and proud to be.

name: Just steps away from the Duomo
host_about: Il nostro appartamento si trova a due passi dal Duomo in una zona antichissima della città, infatti l'appartamento è una ristrutturazione di una "Casa Torre" medievale del 1200. Io e Nicola amiamo moltissimo la nostra città, la cultura, l'arte, le tradizioni culinarie e abbiamo cercato di trasmettere tutto questo studiando con attenzione ogni dettaglio della nostra casa per garantirvi un'esperienza unica nella bellissima Firenze patria di Lorenzo il Magnifico e di Dante Alighieri.

name: David Rocco Dolce Vita Santa Croce
neighborhood_overview: its definitely not in the hustle and bustle of tourists so it allows to integrate with locals including outdoor farmer markets and not to mention close to major attractions Santa Croce, Ponte Vecchio, the Arno, San Niccolo, Piazza Signoria the Accademia Musuem as well as Gli Uffizzi Museum  the synagogue and much more.
host_about:
Live Florence and the language! Experience the Culture! Find yourself in Tuscany!

Hi! I'm Maria. A Canadian who found herself in Tuscany after moving here on a university scholarship in 1993. 

From the moment I stepped foot in Florence, I knew I wanted to live here for the rest of my life. (It was Stendhal syndrome from the word go!!) 

I love contemporary art, organic cooking, jazz music, the tuscan countryside, yoga and everything there is to love about life! 

Join me in Florence for a life-changing adventure!!

name: Appartamento Leone Piazza del Carmine
description:
Characteristic apartment of 50 meters very bright, on the first floor a stone's throw from the Arno and the historic center.
From this point of the city , everything is within walking distance, in a few minutes you can reach all the main points of interest , the central station, Ponte Vecchio, Palazzo Pitti , Via Tornabuoni, Piazza Duomo, Piazza del Carmine, Palazzo Vecchio, the gardens of Boboli, the Parco delle Cascine and about 3 km you can find the wonderful Piazzale Michelangelo.
neighborhood_overview: Narrow streets and tiny sidewalks, small craft shops and local bars, mixed with new pubs and restaurants, create a village atmosphere where you can almost taste the Florence of the past flavored by the freshness of the young people passing by. This is the recipe that makes San Frediano the coolest neighborhood in the world

name: Romantic Apartment
description: Located in the lively neighborhood of Sant Ambrogio, nearby S. Maria del Fiore and S-Croce, the flat has the characteristic florentine style, with travi a vista, parquet, view on the rooftops and two nice caminetti. It has two bedrooms, kitchen, wifi, air conditioning and free parking place (on request). It is ideal for maximum 4 for persons. As almost all the ancient buildings/palaces it has no elevator, but at your arrival you will be surrounded by a unique atmosfera, heartfelt and romantic!
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is located in the lively neighborhood of Sant’Ambrogio, in the heart of the historic centre of Florence nearby the Duomo (Santa Maria del Fiore) and the beautiful Santa Croce Basilica with its gorgeous square. It’s a strategic starting point to easily reach by walk every important monument in the city:  Gallerie dell’Accademia, Uffizi Gallery, Palazzo Vecchio,  Santa Maria Novella, San Marco, San Lorenzo and of course Ponte Vecchio.
host_about:
My name is Claudia, I was born in Tuscany and i moved to Florence to study Art History. I immediately fell in love with this city and from that moment I never wanted to leave. I have lived and worked here for almost 30 years and i’m still astonished/amazed/ breathless by its beauty and history.I bought my apartment in via Fiesolana from an italian artist named Gabriele that used it as its studio, and the rooms still reflects the same disposition the artist needed to paint his works of art. It was love at first sight for me, from the moment i saw the apartment I realized it had to be mine. This apartment in via Fiesolana had been my home for many unforgettable years and I really hope that my guests could experience the same feelings of happiness i felt in this apartment. 
I am loving Florence but also the place where i was born: Monterotondo Marittimo, a small town  the high Maremma at 30 km from the sea.  My parent have a wonderful "colonica" with swimming pool immersed in the countryside and surrounded by greenery of Tuscany country. In the farmhouse I love spending my free time, both in summer and in winter, in total relaxation, in contact with nature. If you want to spend this wonderful experience the house is at your disposal.

name: Studio Suite - near Piazza Signoria
description:
Studio suite furnished in a typical and cozy Florentine style, situated in an antique building right in the centre of Florence (just behind the Uffizi Gallery).
All the major monuments are within a few minutes walking-distance.
The apartment is fully equipped (kitchen, washing machine, air-conditioning, wi-fi etc.).

Hello, we are two friends (Swiss and Austrian) who have been living for many years in the amazing city of Florence. It is now our pleasure to assist our good friend Roberto with the management of his two apartments in the city centre.

name: Characteristic apartment in the heart of Florence
description:
Cozy apartment on the third and last floor of a XV century building in the historic center of Florence near Ponte Vecchio, Uffizi Gallery, Piazza Pitti and Piazza Santa Croce.
I am the owner of the apt, but my lovely mom Betty helps me to welcome you in our beautiful city and apartment.
We help you organize wine tour in the Chianti region, boat trip to the Amalfi coast, restaurants in Rome, cooking class and more! Contact us for details.
neighborhood_overview:
The neighbourhood is just lovely.
It is very quiet even if you are in the heart of Florence.
It is also a safe street full of local people happy to help tourists.
Walking 5 to 10 minutes you can reach historic monuments (Ponte Vecchio, Santa Croce, Palazzo Pitti), arts (Uffizi and Accademia) and the most beautiful gardens of the city (Giardino di Boboli, Giardino delle rose, Giardino Bardini).
host_about:
Hi everybody!
I am Marta, I live in the beautiful city of Florence but I love travel and meet new people and new cultures.
I used to use Airbnb as a guest (and I did enjoy it!!) but now that I have an apartment I decided to also use the website as an host to help people feel comfortable in my city. Since I travel a lot for work, my mom Betty help me with the apartment.

name: TRADITIONAL HOUSE IN THE HEART OF FLORENCE
description:
Our house in the heart of Florence is perfect for a group of friends or a large family, it can accommodate up to 9 people!
It is a historic building with independent entrance, it has 3 double bedrooms & a triple one: one room on the 1st floor with french bed (195x140cm), two double rooms on the 2nd floor and a third double bedroom with two single beds in the attic on the 3rd floor; each bedroom has a private bathroom with shower, TV with Netflix & Air Conditioning.
neighborhood_overview:
We are located in the heart of Florence, 20 meters from Piazza Santa Croce, in a neighborhood that is still authentic, inhabited by the oldest Florentine families and animated by colorful markets, trattorias for connoisseurs, excellent ice cream and artisan shops.
From our B&B, walking pleasantly through the narrow streets of the center, you will reach the most important museums, historic buildings and squares in a few minutes: Uffizi Gallery, the Accademia, the Cathedral, the Ponte Vecchio, Piazzale Michelangelo and the Boboli Gardens. A few steps away you can also reach the Arno river to take beautiful walks along the river and enjoy an unforgettable sunset on the Ponte Vecchio.
In every single room you will find a folder with useful information on what to visit, where to eat and useful shops in the surrounding area.

neighborhood_overview:
Oltrarno is a neighborhood in the historic center of Florence. It is rich in charm and history hosting major monuments, churches, museums and parks: the Pitti Palace, the Church of the Holy Spirit, the Ponte Vecchio, the Boboli Gardens, the Bardini Garden. This part of town is renowned not only for its enchanting historical and artistic background but also for the many artisan shops, characteristic cafes, local markets , which have helped to maintain an authentic atmosphere.
The apartment is located in Via dello Sprone, marked by the famous fountain of Buontalenti and along which it opens onto Piazza della Passera known for hosting several local restaurants as well as cultural events.

name: Double room sunny house in Florence
description: In the quiet and green neighboor of Le Cure, 15 min walking to the center of Florence,  big double room in a sunny and happy house
neighborhood_overview: A quiet neighborhood, with a small river and many green areas, feeling like in a village visiting the daily market in Piazza delle Cure. Unknown to tourists unwilling to venture past piazza della Libertà, the self-contained Le Cure neighbourhood, while by no means a display of Renaissance architecture or the provenance of well-known figures, offers yet another insight into the Florentine suburban lifestyle. Delineated by via Francesco Caracciolo and via della Piazzuola, the popular residential quarter is traversed by the Mugnone torrent in which the washerwomen, “le curandaie” or “le cure”, used to do their laundry, giving the neighbourhood its distinctive name. Le Cure acts as the gateway to Fiesole and its surrounding countryside, ideally placed for those wanting to indulge in both city and country life.

name: Charming House with garden in the City centre
description: Big room with a double bed in a charming house in the heart of the ancient city centre of Florence, close to Piazza S. Annunziata and Piazza del Duomo, and less than a 4 minute walk from the Michelangelo's David. There is a private garden (wich is unique in the city center). A two story house is very quiet and sunny. A green oasis in the heart of the city.
neighborhood_overview:
The house is located in the heart of the old city centre of Florence. You can reach by foot museums, palaces, and churches, some of the greatest artistic treasures of the historic centre of Florence.
Close to the house you can find the traditional district of Sant'Ambrogio, where you can feel as in "a village inside the city" with the interesting food market and the antiques market. There are full of bars and typical restaurants too.
If you arrive by car, you can park in Viale Matteotti or Piazza Donatello (8 min. walking from the house) and you can leave the car there and comfortably visit Florence by foot. The train station is in the city centre too, and from the train station you can reach the house by foot, or by bus (in 15 minutes).
host_about: I'm a 40 years old University Researcher. I love to travel. I'm italian, and I speak English, Portuguese, French and Spanish. I always try to help my guests, giving them all the information about my city.

name: Bright Spacious Oltrarno Home
description: Our bright and comfortable apartment is perfectly located to enjoy the feel of an authentic Florentine neighbourhood within easy walking distance of the historic city centre. Enjoy great parks, restaurants, culture, amenities and parking.
neighborhood_overview:
This apt is ideally placed to enjoy the feeling of a real Oltrarno Italian neighbourhood while being close to the city centre. It is a pleasant 15 minute stroll along the river to the Ponte Vecchio, the Uffizzi and the historical centre of Florence.
There are restaurants locally to suit every taste and budget. Great Indian, Japanese, Seafood, and of course typical Italian restaurants are all here. You are also close to 2 fabulous green areas, the Garden of Villa Strozzi and the Cascine Park, where you can enjoy some peace and quiet, a jog or bike ride along the river. In addition you have all the amenities you would expect in a residential area - supermarket, post office, banks, and secure car parking.
host_about: Hi, I'm Maura and am delighted to host you in my Florence apartment.  I hope you enjoy Florence and Italy as much as I do.

name: Cozy Room With Balcony Steps From Santa Croce
description: WELCOME to the romantic, colorful and comfortable room in the heart of Florence. It is located on the 2nd floor, has a private bathroom, air conditioning and a little private balcony, you can choose between a double bed or two separate single beds
neighborhood_overview:
We are in the heart of Florence, 20 meters from Piazza Santa Croce, in a neighborhood that is still authentic, inhabited by the oldest Florentine families and animated by colorful markets, trattorias for connoisseurs, excellent ice cream and artisan shops.

From our B&B, walking pleasantly through the narrow streets of the center, you will reach the most important museums, historic buildings and squares in a few minutes: Uffizi Gallery, the Accademia, the Cathedral, the Ponte Vecchio, Piazzale Michelangelo and the Boboli Gardens. A few steps away you can also reach the Arno river to take beautiful walks along the river and enjoy an unforgettable sunset on the Ponte Vecchio.

In every single room you will find a folder with useful information on what to visit, where to eat and useful shops in the surrounding area.

If you arrive by car, you can park in the various paid garages near the apartment: Garage Bargello on Via Ghibellina or Garage S. Ambrogio.

name: Dimora Pieri- Strozzi Apartment, San Frediano
description: Completely renovated apartment, located in the historical centre of Florence, in a historical building in one of the most authentic and characteristic district of the city, San Frediano.  Located on the third floor (access by elevator), spacious and bright, it consists of a double bedroom with matrimonial bed, a fully equipped bright kitchen (ovelooking the internal curtyard)   and an elegant bathroom with shower, welcome courtesy kit, hairdryer and towel set.
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is located in the ancient walls of the city, in one of the oldest and most characteristic districts of Florence "San Frediano", Oltrarno, the heart of the Florentine craftsmanship.

Florence Oltrarno, that area between Borgo San Frediano and Borgo Santo Spirito, a treasure trove of the most authentic and genuine Florence, is an area full full of places of interest, picturesque squares and alleys, old artisan workshops and small typical cafés.

Shops that boast customers from all over the world and that tell about the tradition of ceramics, art, woodcarving and decoration. Many artisans still live here. Goldsmith's workshops, streets famous for antiques, such as Via Maggio or places of art where the ancient technique of engraving, metalworking or the fifteenth-century technique of gilding furniture and frames is practiced in the splendid Santo Spirito.

In the immediate vicinity you will find also a pharmacy, a bar restaurant, two small superm
host_about:
The Dimora Pieri  situated in the ancient walls of the city, in one of the oldest and most characteristic districts of Florence, "San Frediano", the heart of the Florentine craftsmanship, which after a careful restoration that ended in 2014 with a careful recovery of the original architecture and finishes, bringing back the original beauty the particular coloured ceramic floors that enrich the rooms, has began his business with the goal to make you feel at home in the beautiful Florence.
Dimora Pieri welcomes its guests in a 3-storey building with elevator and free Wi-Fi,  in 7 apartments with their own original style, equipped with private bathroom, fully equipped kitchen, heating, air conditioning, telephone, safe,  LED TV (digital terrestrial and satellite free channels), large and bright rooms.

In just a few minutes walking you can reach and visit the most important and evocative monuments of Florence as the  S.Spirito church, Basilica of Santa Maria Novella, Carmine church with the Brancacci Chapel, Pitti Palace, Ponte Vecchio, Strozzi Palace, Uffizi Gallery, Palazzo Vecchio, Piazza della Signoria, the Cathedral and Accademia Gallery.

name: Friendly room with two bicycles
description: We're glad to receive you in our cozy and bright apartment located in a tipical and green neighbourhood, the ideal place to start discovering the city. Two vintage bicycles are available to make fast and easy movements around the city.
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is located in the Le Cure neighborhood, a north-eastern district of Florence not far from the city center. The Cure is a very green area and you can enjoy an authentic and typical florentine atmosphere. Here you can find all the services you need: restaurants, bars, tobacco shops, supermarkets... a colorful market is to be found every morning in the main square of the neighborhood.
host_about:
Hello everyone, I've been living in Florence since 5 years. I love to experience the artistic and historical sides of the place where I live and the ones I visit, and their peculiarities as well. 
My ideal vacation is about discovery and adventure, without planning too much ahead but with a tent in the trunk ready ... just in case!  I'm a music lover (I write about it in Italy) and I enjoy reading books and going to the cinema.
As a host, I would like my guests to be completely satisfied and so I offer a clean, cozy and friendly apartment, and many tips to enjoy the city.

Ciao a tutti, vivo a Firenze da 5 anni Mi piace scoprire le arti e le curiosità del luogo in cui vivo e di quelli che visito. La mia vacanza ideale è quella itinerante alla scoperta di posti nuovi, senza troppe tappe programmate e con una tenda nel bagagliaio... pronta per ogni evenienza! Sono un appassionato di musica (di cui scrivo qualcosa qui in Italia:)), leggo libri e vado al cinema.
Come oste, vorrei che i miei ospiti fossero totalmente soddisfatti della loro vacanza e per questo offro una casa pulita, piacevole e accogliente, e tante dritte per poter godere appieno della città.

neighborhood_overview:

host_about:
Ciao, sono Alessandra. Dicono di me che ho un carattere estroverso, sono appassionata di viaggi e di racconti di viaggiatori alla scoperta delle più diverse culture e tradizioni e aperta a nuove conoscenze. Inoltre nel tempo libero amo preparare dolci colazioni della cucina tradizionale toscana e non solo. Andrea, mio marito, collabora nell'accoglienza degli ospiti, assistendoli nelle loro eventuali esigenze e nel rendere rilassante e piacevole il soggiorno.

---

Ciao, I am Alessandra. People say about me that I am  very friendly, I love to travel, the travellers and to know new cultures. During my free time I cook traditional Tuscan cakes and breakfast/specialities.
Andrea, my husband, also enjoys cooperating with his guests, making them experience a relaxing and pleasant stay.

name: CASA BEGONIA
description:
Nice and comfortable 70sqm independent apartment from the early 1900s, of which it maintained the structure (frescoed ceilings, etc.). Very quiet and quiet.
Located in the quiet neighborhood of Cure. Near the center (20 minutes walk, various bus lines in 10 min.). Serving: supermarkets, market square, gardens for children, walks to the hills....) . Those who reach the center on foot will be able to meet and visit historical places of less known Florence.
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is located at Cure, in a very quiet street. "Le Cure" is a historic residential district of the early 1900s, on the slopes of Fiesole, which can be reached on foot passing by picturesque ancient hilly streets. The house has very green surroundings, quiet but with many services and connections. A supermarket coop, a bookstore, typical restaurants, craft shops, bars and famous ice cream parlours are very close.
We will be happy to recommend some nice places to eat for lunch or dinner!
The stores will be opened according to the current provisions of the Municipality regarding the procedures in progress for covid 19 emergency.
It is also close to the sports facilities of Campo di Marte, at the European University.
In the neighborhood there are also large public gardens with areas equipped for children.
host_about: Amo la città di Firenze,  che ancora mi sorprende con la sua bellezza, scoprendo di volta in volta angoli e punti di osservazione nuovi.  Mi fa molto piacere offrire ad altri la possibilità di questa conoscenza.

We are in the heart of Florence, 20 meters from Piazza Santa Croce, in a neighborhood that is still authentic, inhabited by the oldest Florentine families and animated by colorful markets, trattorias for connoisseurs, excellent ice cream and artisan shops.
From our B&B, walking pleasantly through the narrow streets of the center, you will reach the most important museums, historic buildings and squares in a few minutes: Uffizi Gallery, the Accademia, the Cathedral, the Ponte Vecchio, Piazzale Michelangelo and the Boboli Gardens. neighborhood_overview: The street where my apartment is located is very old. There were the first circle of walls that protected Florence, it was a moat called "Scheraggio". The name of the Via dei Leoni is because in ancient times there was a menagerie where lions were bred. The lion was the symbol of the people of Florence. The figure of the lion is in the Florentine coat of arms and the Marzocco is the statue of the Lion that you can admire in Piazza della Signoria.

name: Cavour ChillOut - [2 steps from  the Duomo]
description:
The one thing you have to consider when deciding to stay here is that you will have to climb the stairs to the 4th floor to get home.
If this is not a problem for you, I think you will appreciate the other features of this apartment: its prime location, close to all the cultural and artistic attractions, public transportation and other amenities. Furthermore, its large, airy and bright spaces, and the fact that it is pleasantly quiet, considering that we are in the middle of the city center.
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is close to all the cultural attractions of Florence: 3 min walking distance from Duomo, San Lorenzo market and Galleria dell'Accademia, 5 min from Piazza della Repubblica, 10 min from Piazza della Signoria and Galleria degli Uffizi, 15 min from Piazza Santo Spirito and Piazza Santa Croce. 20-30 min from Piazzale Michelangelo.

The position is also strategic when you don't know what to eat for lunch or dinner, there are many options of restaurants and grocery stores within 5-10min, and there is a supermarket right in front of the apartment!
host_about:
I have a deep love for Florence. 
To stroll through its streets, each one steeped in history, feels like an extraordinary privilege. There's something magical about wandering the city late at night or early in the morning, when it's blissfully quiet and all yours to discover.
Also, the hills that surrounds Florence can be reached in 20 min, and driving around with scooter in summer days is one of my favourite feels.

The center of Florence is beautiful and full of works of art but the Florentine hills are no less. Unfortunately, visitors without their own means have difficulty visiting the "contado” and miss an important part of their experience in Florence. Casina Campofiore is well positioned for a day long hike through the hills. Upon arrival you will receive a map and walking directions, within easy reach of almost all adult visitors.

The centre of Florence is beautiful and rich in works of art but the Florentine hills are no less charming. Unfortunately, visitors without a car or a bike are not usually able to visit the countryside and lose an important part of their experience in Florence. name: Dimora Pieri- Davanzati Apartment, San Frediano
description: Completely renovated apartment, located in the historical centre of Florence, in a historical building in one of the most authentic and characteristic district of the city, San Frediano. Situated on the third floor (access by elevator), very quiet and bright, is consists of a double bedroom with private terrace overlooking the internal courtyard, a fully equipped country style kitchen with a sofa bed and an elegant bathroom with shower, welcome courtesy kit, hairdryer and towel set.
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is located in the ancient walls of the city, in one of the oldest and most characteristic districts of Florence "San Frediano", Oltrarno, the heart of the Florentine craftsmanship.

Florence Oltrarno, that area between Borgo San Frediano and Borgo Santo Spirito, a treasure trove of the most authentic and genuine Florence, is an area full full of places of interest, picturesque squares and alleys, old artisan workshops and small typical cafés.

Shops that boast customers from all over the world and that tell about the tradition of ceramics, art, woodcarving and decoration. Many artisans still live here. Goldsmith's workshops, streets famous for antiques, such as Via Maggio or places of art where the ancient technique of engraving, metalworking or the fifteenth-century technique of gilding furniture and frames is practiced in the splendid Santo Spirito.

In the immediate vicinity you will find also a pharmacy, a bar restaurant, two small superm
host_about:
The Dimora Pieri  situated in the ancient walls of the city, in one of the oldest and most characteristic districts of Florence, "San Frediano", the heart of the Florentine craftsmanship, which after a careful restoration that ended in 2014 with a careful recovery of the original architecture and finishes, bringing back the original beauty the particular coloured ceramic floors that enrich the rooms, has began his business with the goal to make you feel at home in the beautiful Florence.
Dimora Pieri welcomes its guests in a 3-storey building with elevator and free Wi-Fi,  in 7 apartments with their own original style, equipped with private bathroom, fully equipped kitchen, heating, air conditioning, telephone, safe,  LED TV (digital terrestrial and satellite free channels), large and bright rooms.

In just a few minutes walking you can reach and visit the most important and evocative monuments of Florence as the  S.Spirito church, Basilica of Santa Maria Novella, Carmine church with the Brancacci Chapel, Pitti Palace, Ponte Vecchio, Strozzi Palace, Uffizi Gallery, Palazzo Vecchio, Piazza della Signoria, the Cathedral and Accademia Gallery.

name: Cozy Apartment in the heart of Florence
description:
Cozy accommodation for an unforgettable holiday in the historic center of Florence.

Bright apartment of 60 sqm located on the first floor in a typical Florentine neighborhood in the historic center of Florence. Only a few minutes from Florence's central SMN Station and the city's main attractions.
neighborhood_overview:
Santa Maria Novella is located in the northwestern part of Florence's Old Town. In this area we find Florence's central train station, where most trains arrive from every region of Italy and abroad. Its central location allows tourists to arrive by train and visit the main monuments on foot without having to take taxis or buses.
  In addition to the beautiful church of Santa Maria Novella we find the Teatro Comunale, the Palazzo dei Congressi, the Fortezza da Basso - home to important events such as the exhibition of craftsmanship or Pitti Immagine - the Chiesa di Ognissanti, the Parco delle Cascine and many other attractions. You can reach Florence Cathedral on foot in just over 5 minutes. There are also many pubs and clubs in the Santa Maria Novella area.
  In this area, just outside the station, you reach San Lorenzo, famous for the market, where you can eat typical and quality dishes and find handmade items.

neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is located in one of Florence’s liveliest neighborhoods and provides a rare glimpse of “old” Florence with typical antique shops and artisan studios: locals still live and work in this area and have not given it over completely to generic chain shops and hotels as some other areas of the center have slowly done. If you are looking for luxury shopping, the main shopping street, Via Tornabuoni, is also only a few minutes’ walk.

All of the city's main monuments and points of interests can be quickly and easily reached on foot. To name a few examples: Florence’s landmark, the Duomo, Piazza della Signoria, Palazzo Vecchio, Ponte Vecchio, the Bargello (one of Italy’s most important sculpture museums), the Casa Buonarroti, (the former home of Michelangelo), and of course the magnificent Santa Croce church and museum.

The apartment is in a restricted traffic area and so it is quiet and tranquil.

name: Dimora Pieri- Corsini Apartment, San Frediano
description:
Completely renovated apartment, located in the historical centre of Florence, in a historical building in one of the most authentic and characteristic district of the city, San Frediano.
Located on the first floor (access by lift), quiet and bright, it is consists of a double bedroom, a living room offering a single bed, a beautiful private loggia/terrace overlooking the internal courtyard, a fully equipped kitchen and a bathroom with shower, welcome courtesy kit, hairdryer and set of towels.
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is located in the ancient walls of the city, in one of the oldest and most characteristic districts of Florence "San Frediano", Oltrarno, the heart of the Florentine craftsmanship.

Florence Oltrarno, that area between Borgo San Frediano and Borgo Santo Spirito, a treasure trove of the most authentic and genuine Florence, is an area full full of places of interest, picturesque squares and alleys, old artisan workshops and small typical cafés.

Shops that boast customers from all over the world and that tell about the tradition of ceramics, art, woodcarving and decoration. Many artisans still live here. Goldsmith's workshops, streets famous for antiques, such as Via Maggio or places of art where the ancient technique of engraving, metalworking or the fifteenth-century technique of gilding furniture and frames is practiced in the splendid Santo Spirito.

In the immediate vicinity you will find also a pharmacy, a bar restaurant, two small superm
host_about:
The Dimora Pieri  situated in the ancient walls of the city, in one of the oldest and most characteristic districts of Florence, "San Frediano", the heart of the Florentine craftsmanship, which after a careful restoration that ended in 2014 with a careful recovery of the original architecture and finishes, bringing back the original beauty the particular coloured ceramic floors that enrich the rooms, has began his business with the goal to make you feel at home in the beautiful Florence.
Dimora Pieri welcomes its guests in a 3-storey building with elevator and free Wi-Fi,  in 7 apartments with their own original style, equipped with private bathroom, fully equipped kitchen, heating, air conditioning, telephone, safe,  LED TV (digital terrestrial and satellite free channels), large and bright rooms.

In just a few minutes walking you can reach and visit the most important and evocative monuments of Florence as the  S.Spirito church, Basilica of Santa Maria Novella, Carmine church with the Brancacci Chapel, Pitti Palace, Ponte Vecchio, Strozzi Palace, Uffizi Gallery, Palazzo Vecchio, Piazza della Signoria, the Cathedral and Accademia Gallery.

Florence Oltrarno, that area between Borgo San Frediano and Borgo Santo Spirito, a treasure trove of the most authentic and genuine Florence, is an area full full of places of interest, picturesque squares and alleys, old artisan workshops and small typical cafés.

Shops that boast customers from all over the world and that tell about the tradition of ceramics, art, woodcarving and decoration. Many artisans still live here. Goldsmith's workshops, streets famous for antiques, such as Via Maggio or places of art where the ancient technique of engraving, metalworking or the fifteenth-century technique of gilding furniture and frames is practiced in the splendid Santo Spirito.

In the immediate vicinity you will find also a pharmacy, a bar restaurant, two small superm
host_about:
The Dimora Pieri  situated in the ancient walls of the city, in one of the oldest and most characteristic districts of Florence, "San Frediano", the heart of the Florentine craftsmanship, which after a careful restoration that ended in 2014 with a careful recovery of the original architecture and finishes, bringing back the original beauty the particular coloured ceramic floors that enrich the rooms, has began his business with the goal to make you feel at home in the beautiful Florence.
Dimora Pieri welcomes its guests in a 3-storey building with elevator and free Wi-Fi,  in 7 apartments with their own original style, equipped with private bathroom, fully equipped kitchen, heating, air conditioning, telephone, safe,  LED TV (digital terrestrial and satellite free channels), large and bright rooms.

In just a few minutes walking you can reach and visit the most important and evocative monuments of Florence as the  S.Spirito church, Basilica of Santa Maria Novella, Carmine church with the Brancacci Chapel, Pitti Palace, Ponte Vecchio, Strozzi Palace, Uffizi Gallery, Palazzo Vecchio, Piazza della Signoria, the Cathedral and Accademia Gallery.

name: Spacious family home w/ garden near Via Boccaccio
description:
Our apartment in the greenest part of Florence combines the benefits of living in a friendly, vibrant and beautiful neighbourhood with all amenities within walking distance to Giotto's Duomo with the advantages of cleaner air and ease of access to the countryside without getting trapped in traffic.

We have three children ourselves and welcome families with kids.
neighborhood_overview: Le Cure is a pretty neighbourhood in the north of Florence, near the famous Florentine Hills in the direction of Fiesole. It runs along the banks of the river Mugnone and features many trees as well as great views of Fiesole. All amenities, many restaurants and hundreds of boutique shops are within easy walking distance. Parco Pettini Burresi, one of the best playgrounds in Florence, is around 300 meters away. The European University Institute, is within ten minutes walk up Via Boccaccio.
host_about: I am a research fellow at the European University Institute in Florence. My husband teaches English there. We have three boys, currently aged three, six, and eight.

name: Il Giglio di Maria in S. Spirito
description: I am happy to welcome you to my apartment: a cozy, homey nest and a perfect starting point for discovering the magical Florence! Anticipated by the lovely inner courtyard, it will provide you with all the comforts so that you could enjoy the authentic district of the apartment and wander around the city without worries. Not far from the house, you will find the Teatro Goldoni, Basilica di Santo Spirito, the Palazzo Pitti and Giardino di Boboli!
neighborhood_overview: Welcome to one of the most authentic, lively and representative areas of the city. Located a stone’s throw from Basilica di Santo Spirito, Palazzo Pitti and Giardino di Boboli, my apartment will be the perfect starting point for discovering the whole Florence! In addition to all the famous sights that you will find not far from the house, you will be able to wander through many boutiques of local artisans, to taste a great dish in one of the delicious taverns and trattorias of the area, to enjoy some relaxation and leisure sipping a good glass of wine or tasting a cocktail at one of the numerous bars that populate these streets. This area is renowned, in fact, for its historical and traditional aspect, as well as for its energetic nightlife. The connection with Santa Maria Novella station is also excellent, it is just 15 minutes walk from home!
host_about:
Ciao sono Anna, fiorentina di origine adoro la mia città soprattutto la zona di Oltrarno poiché ritengo che sia la più autentica e vera parte di Firenze rimasta ancora tale.
Vorrei che anche voi ospiti poteste vivere nel mio accogliente nido una bella esperienza alla scoperta delle bellezze di questo posto ricco di storia ed emozionanti angoli poetici.
La mia più grande passione é la mia famiglia, i miei animali e viaggiare oltre all’arte ed alla cucina tradizionale italiana.
La parte che preferisco, a pochi passi dell’appartamento, che riesce ad emozionarmi sempre ogni volta è la chiesa di Santo Spirito con la sua piazza antistante ricca di locali e genuinità fiorentina.
Non potete andare via da Firenze senza aver assaggiato il mio panino preferito da Simone il trippaio di San Frediano in piazza dei Nerli.
Buona visita e divertitevi nella culla della cultura italiana!!

-----

Hi, I’m Anna. I was born in Florence and I love my city, especially the area of Oltrarno since I believe that it is the most authentic and true part of Florence, which has still remained such. I’d like you, my guests, to be able to have wonderful experience in my cozy nest, discovering the beauty of this place which is rich in history and in exciting poetic corners. My biggest passions are my family, my animals and traveling, in addition to art and traditional Italian cuisine. My favourite part of the city, located a stone’s throw from the apartment, is Santo Spirito Church, which always manages to thrill me thanks to the square in front of it. The latter is full of cafes, bars and Florentine genuineness. You can't leave Florence without having tasted my favourite sandwich by Simone, the tripe place from San Frediano in piazza dei Nerli. Have a nice trip and have fun in the cradle of Italian culture!!

name: Snuggle up in the Rustic Woven Bed in Historic Oltrarno
description: Pluck a book from the open shelves and sink into the slouchy corner sofa at this serene retreat just meters from Ponte Vecchio and Palazzo Pitti. This soothing space features smooth arched doorways and a crisp, white color palette.
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is located in the district of antique dealers and craftsmen, Oltrarno, near Piazza Santo Spirito.
There are the artisan shops of yesteryear, which give a dip in the history of Florence. But there are also new venues, modern and contemporary, European, minimalist, restaurants and pubs with live music. With its narrow streets and small sidewalks, everything is enclosed between the ancient gates of the city, Borgo San Frediano, Piazza Santo Spirito and San Niccolò.
Take a walk in San Niccolò especially in the evening to end the day in one of the wine bars near the Porta San Giorgio or for lunch, for a relaxing break from visiting the city.
Continue your journey to Piazzale Michelangelo to enjoy a wonderful sunset.
Do you want to follow the itinerary of the churches? Here in Oltrarno there are certainly no shortages: in the District of San Frediano, the Brancacci Chapel in the Church of Santa Maria del Carmine with the frescoes of Masaccio, as well as th
host_about:
Vivo a Firenze con mio marito, Massimiliano. Ad entrambi piace viaggiare ed abbiamo pensato a fornire tutte le comodità che di solito apprezziamo quando ci troviamo all'estero. Speriamo che la nostra casa vi piaccia così come l'amiamo noi. 

I live in Florence with my husband. We both like to travel and we have thought of providing all the comforts that we usually appreciate when we are abroad.
We hope you'll like our house as like we love it!

name: Flower Cathedral Orchid Room 2 - Duomo View!
description:
Beautiful private room with a breathtaking view of the Santa Maria del Fiore Cathedral. This is the spot for an adventurous getaway in birthplace of the Renaissance. If you like to people watch, this room is for you. You'll see the whole city pass by; travelers, local florentines on their way to work, you will never be bored looking out this window. And what a view!
We are at your service to make your stay with us extra special and we look forward to sharing this beautiful city with you!
neighborhood_overview: We are located in Piazza Duomo. When you step out the front door of the building the Santa Maria del Fiore Cathedral is right in front of you. The neighborhood is filled with travelers exploring the local historical sites as well as locals on their way about town. It is a very exciting location, since many festivities happen right in our square, including the Scoppio del Carro ("Explosion of the Cart") a folk tradition of Florence and the December 8th Christmas tree lighting ceremony. Both of which you will be able to see from your window.

name: Ponte Vecchio charming apartment "Red"
description: Delightful 70 sqm (800 sq.ft.) spacious apartment located at the 2nd  floor of an ancient building, with elevator, between  Ponte Vecchio bridge and  Santa Trinita Church, in the pedestrian  quiet zone of the city. Recently renovated in modern style.  Walking distance from the main attractions:  Duomo, Palazzo Vecchio, Uffizi Gallery,  Palazzo Pitti. Just cross the river Arno to discover the other side of Florentine life in the bohemian "Oltrarno" and Santo Spirito neighbourhood.
neighborhood_overview: You couldn’t ask for a better location in Florence. We promise you’ll be happy for choice when staying at this nice an d quiet apartment. You have everything within a short walking distance, from great fashion and vintage stores, restaurants, cosy coffee and wine bars, traditional tuscany meals in the restaurants and all the main tourist attractions easily reachable by foot:  The bridge with goldsmith shops Ponte Vecchio is few meters far, Santa Trinita Church with the frescoes of Ghirlandaio is behind the corner, the Duomo - the Cathedral, Palazzo Vecchio - the town hall and the Uffizi Gallery, basilica Santa Maria Novella  are only a 5-10 minute walk away! The Academia with the famous David is also in a walking distance. To escape the hustle of the centre, you also have the wonderful option to cross the river Arno to visit Palazzo Pitti where the Medici family used to live with the famous paintings of "Palatina" Gallery and Boboli garden, with it's breath taking views over the city.
host_about: Valter is interested in history, politics, environment, with a special passion for  Tuscany and Florence!

neighborhood_overview: We are located in Piazza Duomo. When you step out the front door of the building the Santa Maria del Fiore Cathedral is right in front of you. The neighborhood is filled with travelers exploring the local historical sites as well as locals on their way about town. name: Ponte Vecchio charming apartment "Blue"
description: Delightful 65 sqmt apartment  located at the 2nd  floor of an ancient building, with elevator,  between Ponte Vecchio and  Santa Trinita bridges in the pedestrian quiet zone of the city. Recently renovated in modern style. Walking distance from the main attractions: Duomo, Palazzo Vecchio, Uffizi Gallery,  Palazzo Pitti and Boboli garden, fashion boutiques. Just cross the river Arno  discover the other side of florentine life in the bohemian "Oltrarno" and Santo Spirito neighbourhood.
neighborhood_overview: You couldn't find  a better location in Florence!  We promise you will be spoilt for choice when you stay in this lovely, quiet and spacious apartment. You have everything within walking distance, great fashionable shops, restaurants, bars, cozy pastry shops and wine shops and all the main tourist attractions within walking distance: Ponte Vecchio is just a few meters away, the Church of Santa Trinita is just a few meters away, the Cathedral, Palazzo Vecchio: the Basilica of Santa Maria Novella and the Uffizi Gallery is only 7-10 minutes walk away!  even the David in Academia is easily reachable on foot. To escape the hustle and bustle of downtown, you also have the wonderful chance to cross the Arno River to discover the other side of Florentine life in the "Oltrarno" district with a glass of wine or aperitif in Piazza Santo Spirito. On the left bank you will find Palazzo Pitti with the "Palatina" Gallery and the Boboli Garden with its breathtaking views of the city,  Piazzale Michela
host_about: Valter is interested in history, politics, environment, with a special passion for  Tuscany and Florence!

name: Beautiful apartment close to Duomo and S.Croce
description: Third floor of a historical building in the heart of the city, located in a quiet street, in a lively area with many nearby  restaurants, very close to the Duomo and Ponte Vecchio. The apt is 85 sq. mts., with one large bedroom, one bathroom with shower, a little balcony overlooking the old synagogue and a large living space with an open kitchen, a living room area and a bedroom area. High speed wi-fi and A/C.  An amazing old wood ceiling and a parquet floor make this apartment really beautiful.
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is in the heart of Sant’Ambrogio district, one of the oldest  of Florence, mostly frequented by students and young people. It is very close - five minutes on foot - to the Duomo (Brunelleschi dome),  Santa Croce cathedral  and the Old Bridge (Ponte Vecchio). The neighborhood is known to be home to the old ghetto of the town, the part of Florence where the Jewish community used to live, which is one of the largest in Italy. Still today this area is home to excellent Jewish restaurants and interesting museums, as well as the beautiful Synagogue clearly visible from the windows in the living room. It also hosts one of the most important open air food markets of the town and several restaurants. In the summertime it is one of the main hubs of the Florentine movida. Still, the street where the apartment lies is very quiet.

name: Super quiet apartment 5 minuts from the Duomo!A/C.
description:
Dear guests, the apartment is located in the heart of the historic center of beautiful Florence.
It is a charming place, very quiet, completely renovated and equipped with every comfort that will allow you, thanks to its location, to reach the historical and artistic heritage of this beautiful city on foot in 5 minutes.
At the end of the day you can also enjoy the silence and the view of the Florentine rooftops that make the balcony with which the apartment is equipped unique.
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is located in Borgo Pinti, one of the neighborhoods in which the Florentine historical center is divided.
The location of this neighborhood is very strategic.
On the one hand you will have at your disposal, just a few minutes walk, the main places of tourist interest (The Cathedral and Piazza della Signoria are within 5 minutes walk), on the other hand you will find yourself immersed in the everyday life of the inhabitants of Florence.
In fact, there are still some old shops in this neighborhood, some very good trattorias where you can eat typical Tuscan dishes in a timeless atmosphere or you can choose to take a walk in the district market of Sant'Ambrogio.
In short, you'll be spoiled for choice among the thousands of attractions the city and this ancient neighborhood offer.

description: The suite "La Nicchia Guelfa" has been the subject of a recent and careful renovation aimed at safeguarding the historical-structural heritage of the area in which it is located; part of a convent,adjacent to the Basilica of San Lorenzo, probably dating back to 1500/1600 is characterized by the presence of niches inserted in stone walls at the time used for kitchen and prayer; the furniture faithfully reproduces the classic Florentine style.

name: La casetta dei Tucani
description: The apartment is located on the first floor of a typical Florentine building, is located in the heart of Florence, close to all the most important historical monuments, Santa Croce and Duomo are within walking distance less than 10 minutes, other monuments such as Ponte Vecchio, Uffizi Gallery and Piazza delle Repubblica, are within walking distance in just 10/15 minutes. You will love staying in the apartment because it is cozy, well located and very quiet. Suitable for couples or small groups (max 4 people)
neighborhood_overview:
The Basilica of Santa Croce will catch your attention and you can only sit on one of the benches in the square in front of the church to enjoy the show.
It's a must for your stay in Florence.
Although the area is very popular with tourists, it has still maintained its original profile: walking through the streets and small squares you will discover small shops and non-tourist shops and smaller museums, only in terms of size, where you can stop and discover small curiosities.

Here are some info about its history:
This Franciscan basilica was started in 1295 on a project by Arnolfo di Cambio. It contains countless works of art, including Giotto's famous frescoes in the Peruzzi and Bardi chapels, and is universally famous because some of the most illustrious figures in our country are buried there. Among the most important monuments to mention are the tomb of Alfieri, the work of Canova, that of Leonardo Bruni, the work of Rossellino, that of Carlotta Bonaparte

name: Honey Home in San Frediano
description: Lovely Terraced House on three floors with independent entrance located in San Frediano distric, Florence side called "Oltrarno". Ground floor, living room with fully equipped kitchen, study area and outdoor area with table. First floor, master bedroom with private bathroom and second bathroom, both bathrooms have very spacious shower, toilet, bidet and sink. Second floor, bedroom with two single beds that can be joined to in a double bed and a relax/reading corner with a comfortable armchair.
neighborhood_overview:
Borgo San Frediano, a neighborhood in Florence, Lonely Planet has proclaimed this as the coolest in the world. In practice, it is one of the places to visit at least once in your life! The newspapers around the world have talked about it for a long time, but we at Tuscan Feeling.
The beauties and architecture found in Borgo San Frediano are not as famous as those in the center of Florence, but for this reason they are no less interesting. Indeed, the atmosphere of the neighborhood and the beauty of certain streets will transport you back in time.
San Frediano has artistic treasures such as the Basilica of Santa Maria del Carmine (Brancacci Chapel, decorated by Masaccio), the church of Santo Spirito (signed by Brunelleschi, in the sacristy preserves the crucifix made in youth by Michelangelo) and that of the Cestello, which took today the title of church of San Frediano.

The district is very beautiful. Very close to our house there are several historical gardens: Giardino della Fortezza, Giardino dell'Orticoltura, Parco Stibbert.
Just down the street you can found the best ice-cream shop in town (Gelateria dei Medici), a very famous pizzeria (Spera) and several pastry shops.

name: Lo Studiolo, vicino al Duomo
description:
Lo Studiolo is a delightful small apartment located in the center of Florence a stone's throw from the Duomo and S.Maria Novella station.
Theapartment, equipped with all comforts and furnished with care and love, looks like a magical and colorful treasure that reflects my creativity and personality .
neighborhood_overview:
The area is lively and will certainly not leave any unfulfilled desires.
For fans of luxury shopping, Via Tornabuoni and Via della Vigna offer the most beautiful showcases of fashion design, but also in the small streets that connect them and right under the house, there are antique shops and artisans where you can find artistic objects and real unique pieces.
For art lovers, the church of Santa Maria Novella, the same station built in the early 1930s by Michelucci, the Rucellai chapel, the Museo Marini, the Baroque church of Saints Michele and Gaetano, the church of Santa Trinita, the Palazzo Strozzi, are just a few examples of what you can find when you leave the accommodation.
Not to mention Piazza Signoria, the Uffizi and the Cathedral are just a 10-minute walk away.
For breakfast, a snack, a cocktail in the evening, or dinner in a restaurant, stroll through the narrow streets and you'll find places for all tastes.
There is also a bakery where you can als
host_about:
Creativa, curiosa e solare, mi sono trasferita al nord, Vienna, dove continuo ad occuparmi di opere d´arte in veste di restauratrice.
Amo anche molto stare in mezzo alla natura e cerco l´armonia e l´energia positiva in tutte le cose. 
I libri sono i miei compagni, insieme alla macchina fotografica; una foto, per me, racconta sempre una storia. 
Cerco di rendere ogni ambiente personale e unico come il mio Studiolo e mi auguro che, gli ospiti che lo abiteranno, si trovino in un alloggio piacevole che li accolga con armonia dopo le intense giornate trascorse in città

name: A Genuine Florence Experience
description:
A genuine Florence experience: in the trendy Oltrarno neighborhood of San Frediano, this well-furnished, 3 bedroom, 2 bath house, also has a large rooftop terrace. It's very close to many great restaurants and all the sights south of the river Arno, and an easy walk to the historic center.
This house is for those who want to experience the authentic Florence and do something interesting and adventuresome – from their own comfortable Florentine home.
neighborhood_overview:
This is a real Florence neighborhood: outside the crowded touristy center, but close to everything and very walkable. Time Out recently listed the Oltrarno as one of "the 50 coolest neighborhoods in the world," and Lonely Planet says San Frediano (our neighborhood in the Oltrarno) is among the "10 coolest neighbourhoods to visit right now."

We are a few minutes walk to some of Florence’s best local trattorias and wine bars, like La Vecchia Bettola, which is a two minute walk (and great fun to eat outside on a summer night or indoors by the stove on a winter night); Trattoria del Carmine (also a favorite); the very cozy and inexpensive Sabatino; Antico Ristoro di Cambi (famous for steaks – la bistecca Fiorentina), the popular Quattro (4) Leoni, and the charming Tranvai, all for traditional and delicious Florentine food. Romantic Le Barrique, the highly-rated Io - Osteria Personale, and the trendy Il Santo Bevitore offer something a bit more modern. Great pizza is just off Po
host_about: I have been traveling and researching in Italy for many years.

name: Nonna Anna apartment
description:
The nonna Anna apartment, recently and completely renovated,has developed into a single floor and consists of:
- living room with kichenette equipped with all appliances, as well as a confortable three-scater sofa and TV
- a double bedroom with a private bathroom with a shower box
- a second bedroom with a French bed
- a second bathroom also equipped with a shower box
- a small living room with doble sofa bed and TV which leads to the lovely balcony overlooking the walls of S. Miniato
neighborhood_overview:
You will have the opportunity to stay in a neighborhood with the real riot of smells and scents that will drive your taste buds crazy.
At any hour, in fact, you can satisfy your cravings: if the aperitif has arrived, there is the Rifrullo (20 meters away), which has always been perfect for a spritz and a rich buffet accompanied by music from the vivonel its courtyard.
ZeB (50 meters away) at the corner with Via S. Miniato with its proposals for typical Tuscan cuisine but with a chic flavor:excellent combination of class and tradition. In addition, the Beppa Fioraia in Via dell 'Erta Canina will tempt you with its cutting boards, meat but also pizza in a rustic setting with ample green space.
The neighborhood offers this and much more among wine bars, hot tables, and bakeries.
Thanks to the central location you will enjoy, you can move to other clubs and/or restaurants in the neighboring neighborhoods.
Among these, I cannot but mention the neighborhood of S. Cro

name: Flat " Sole"- in the hearth of Florence
description:
Come and enjoy an unforgettable time in the very hearth of the city.
Bright apartment. First floor, 4people
The flat is at few steps from the well known "Tornabuoni" street and at few min walking from the Cathedral and all the main points of interest in town.
neighborhood_overview:
A lively and dynamic neighborhood in the heart of the city. The main cathedral the "Duomo" and all the main points of interest in town are at few steps walking. The area is well served from bakeries,butchers, fishmorgers and all what you need to live like a local. You cannot miss the San Lorenzo Market for fresh and quality products.
For shopping lovers the well known "Tornabuoni" street is just behind the corner and please don t forget to stop by "Procacci" cafe to taste the delicious "panino tartufato" enjoying a fresh glass of wine.
Five minutes from the main train station of Santa Maria Novella. The area is well served by public transport and taxis. The theatre "Maggio Musicale" and the green Florence ( Cascian park) is at 15min walking.

name: Top Floor Jewel in Florence
description: Spectacular Top Floor Apartment with views over the Giardini Torrigiani. We fully refurbished this apartment to reflect the history, architecture, and materials of Florence with all the amenities a modern life requires. The apartment is designed to sleep 4 very comfortably and spans a total of 125sqm. The flat is located on a residential part of Via dei Serragli  but within walking distance of all of Florence's spectacular sights and sounds.This truly is a home away from home.
neighborhood_overview: Via dei Serragli is lined with grand Renaissance palaces; as it progresses south towards Porta Romana, the houses become more residential. Within a few minutes' walk is the Pitti Palace and adjoining Boboli Gardens, the Ponte Vecchio and the Brancacci chapel, decorated with masterful frescoes by Masaccio, Masolino and Lippi. Lively piazza Santo Spirito is a pigeon’s spit away and the whole area is stuffed with interesting places to eat, drink and shop.
host_about: I have been travelling all my life with my parents, for work and of course for pleasure since I was made and born in Taipeh/Taiwan of all places. I am of German origin and over the years have been particularly taken by Tuscany. I try to spend quality time at my house but it stays empty alot of the year and a house lived in is always the better solution. I love the light and the towns of Forte dei Marmi and Pietrasanta that ate located within 10 minute drives from the house not the mention the incredble stretch of sandy beach that runs for kms along the coastline. Take the plunge and enjoy is all I can say. Thanks for looking.

This bright apartment has been our first nest and still is a piece of our heart.
Its location is simply excellent: situated next to the elegant shopping district of Via Tornabuoni, it´s right in the center of the old town, so it´s close to any attraction. neighborhood_overview:
The flat is in an area that can offer you the best of Florence, whether you are staying for just one night or for a long time.
Although you ´ll find yourself next to the most elegant street of the city and 500 mt away form the Cathedral, you´ll discover that the neighbor is lively, with many convenience shops nearby (bakery, supermarket, drugstores etc.). You can enjoy all the tourist attractions and be also part of the real Florentine life!

name: VILLA MEDICEA
description:
A dreaming luxury Villa overlooking Firenze and the Brunelleschi Cupola, set in a fantastic position up to a hill. In the XV century it became one of the properties of the Medici family.  The villa is the perfect place to celebrate a private event.  Hidden in a big park, it has a wide terrace overlooking Florence, 7 luxurious Suites and services of a 5 star hotel, not to mention the amazing stone pool. Full staffed equipped, the Villa is rented in exclusive, on a base of Bed and Breakfast and cook is at disposal of guests for lunch and dinner. No kitchen room available for self catering use.

The Seven exclusive Suites can host 14 guests in double occupancy. Most of them are wide enough to add extra beds in their living room areas, for a maximum capacity of 25 guests.

name: Center: girls only independent room for single use
description: In the historic neighborhood of San Frediano, in the heart of the old city center, in an elegant period building with an elevator, we have a comfortable single room available for rent. The room features a 1 + 1/2 size bed (French size), wardrobe, and desk with chair, with bed linen and towels provided. There is a shared terrace with a view that you can use (accessible from the common dining area). In the house, you will find two tenants and a friendly kitten.
neighborhood_overview:
San Frediano is a charming neighborhood located in the southwest part of Florence's historic center, Italy. Known for its bohemian atmosphere and authentic character, San Frediano is loved by both residents and visitors for its paved streets, historic buildings, and lively art scene.

One of the most distinctive features of San Frediano is its well-preserved medieval architecture, with many buildings dating back to the Renaissance period. The narrow, winding streets are bordered by colorful buildings with painted facades and balconies adorned with flowers, which give the neighborhood a picturesque and romantic atmosphere.

The neighborhood is renowned for its artisans and their shops, where you can find traditional craftsmanship such as leather processing, weaving, and woodworking. The streets are buzzing with antique shops, art galleries, cozy cafes, and quaint restaurants that offer authentic Tuscan cuisine.

name: Luminoso e Tranquillo Bilocale Santa Maria Novella
description: Located just 5 minutes walking from Santa Maria Novella Railway Station, this bright two-room apartment is perfect for couples or families visiting. Third floor, without elevator, features a large living area and a very bright kitchen thanks to the two large windows. The room is very quiet and overlooks the interior, with a delightful open view. Window bathroom with large shower. Very fast WiFi (FTTH Fiber). Air conditioning and washing machine.
neighborhood_overview:
We are in the Santa Maria Novella District, a few steps from the Central Station, from the city's major tourist attractions and the Fortezza da Basso, home to the important fashion events Pitti Immagine Moda and Pitti Bimbo.
A few hundred meters from Florence's Central Market, the Mercato di San Lorenzo, located in a beautiful cast-iron and glass building from the second half of the 19th century.
On the ground floor you will find butchers, fishmongers, fruit and vegetable stalls and small shops selling local specialties such as olive oil, meat, cheese and much, much more.
On the second floor , open 7 days a week, from 10 am to midnight, you can find all the Florentine culinary specialties, such as cheeses, Chianti, soups and baked goods, a single shopping center dedicated completely to food and divided into categories and banquets where you can stop to simply buy something to take away, or sit down to taste some freshly made local specialties (and believe me, you will b
host_about: Valter is interested in history, politics, environment, with a special passion for  Tuscany and Florence!

host_about: Business Management Graduate with a passion for travel and food. I work at Rangoni Shoes and represent the third generation of our company: in 1937 my grandfather started producing shoes of the highest quality in Florence. Our company is small almost a laboratory and we work as a family. I am proud of our craftsmanship, but above all of our long history that I would like to share. I know three languages because I have been living in four countries: Spain, USA, UK and France, but I would love to try more!  worked in contact with the public by selling in our stores in the USA. I can't wait to discover the world and meet new people!

neighborhood_overview:
Le Cure is a residential neighborhood that is very popular with citizens of Florence, just north of the historic center of Florence, at the foot of the Fiesole hill, where the past coexists with the present, the name of the "Cure" neighborhood comes from "Curandaie", or the lavender that used to wash linen in the waters of the nearby Mugnone River.
It is a neighborhood well known for its many lush green areas and for its very appreciated daily market that is held right in Piazza delle Cure. Here every day of the year you can find fresh and typical products, both food and craft, of every variety. The Cure Market has been a hangout for all the locals for many years.

I used to live there, you have everything you need in a short walk

name: "Lulù"
description:

The excellent central location allows you to reach monuments and sites of historical and tourist interest in a short time, while in the evening the area is home to numerous nightlife venues.

name: DA VINCI a Firenze incantevole appartamento
description:
Relax in this quiet space centrally located...a pampering in Florence Oltrarno area Santo Spirito, the heart of the Florentine handicrafts and life, the most authentic and characteristic place thanks to the curious and interesting cultural and culinary artistic activities both day and night!
In addition to being very cozy, the house has all the necessary comforts ,quiet even though immersed in the historic center, bright and colorful.
host_about:
Ciao sono Anna, fiorentina di origine adoro la mia città soprattutto la zona di Oltrarno poiché ritengo che sia la più autentica e vera parte di Firenze rimasta ancora tale.
Vorrei che anche voi ospiti poteste vivere nel mio accogliente nido una bella esperienza alla scoperta delle bellezze di questo posto ricco di storia ed emozionanti angoli poetici.
La mia più grande passione é la mia famiglia, i miei animali e viaggiare oltre all’arte ed alla cucina tradizionale italiana.
La parte che preferisco, a pochi passi dell’appartamento, che riesce ad emozionarmi sempre ogni volta è la chiesa di Santo Spirito con la sua piazza antistante ricca di locali e genuinità fiorentina.
Non potete andare via da Firenze senza aver assaggiato il mio panino preferito da Simone il trippaio di San Frediano in piazza dei Nerli.
Buona visita e divertitevi nella culla della cultura italiana!!

-----

Hi, I’m Anna. I was born in Florence and I love my city, especially the area of Oltrarno since I believe that it is the most authentic and true part of Florence, which has still remained such. I’d like you, my guests, to be able to have wonderful experience in my cozy nest, discovering the beauty of this place which is rich in history and in exciting poetic corners. My biggest passions are my family, my animals and traveling, in addition to art and traditional Italian cuisine. My favourite part of the city, located a stone’s throw from the apartment, is Santo Spirito Church, which always manages to thrill me thanks to the square in front of it. The latter is full of cafes, bars and Florentine genuineness. You can't leave Florence without having tasted my favourite sandwich by Simone, the tripe place from San Frediano in piazza dei Nerli. Have a nice trip and have fun in the cradle of Italian culture!!

It is also only 10 minutes away to Piazza Santo Spirito, with all its bars and restaurants. Train station is only 1,3km away (15-20 minutes walking), while the Duomo is 1,5km away.

name: Un piccolo rifugio a Firenze
description: The apartment is located in the historic center of Florence, a short walk from all the monuments and museums of the city. It is located on the slightly basement floor of a small 19th century building and has single access from a small private courtyard with gate. Itconsists of a living room with kitchenette, a small hallway, a bathroom and a bedroom with a double bed (French). Although it is located in the center of Florence, it is very quiet.
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is about 1 km from Campo di Marte station and is therefore easily reachable by train. In the immediate vicinity (200 meters) is Piazza Leon Battista Alberti with ample parking for cars. About 50 meters from the apartment is Via Vincenzo Gioberti, Florence's famous shopping street. Continuing towards the city center, about 600 meters away is Piazza Beccaria and, later, Piazza Santa Croce, Piazza della Signoria, etc. Within 500 meters there are supermarkets, bus stops, city lines, banks, post office, etc.

name: DANTE LUXURY
description:
A unique and modern apartment into and ancient medieval tower, one of the oldest and most beautiful of Florence, whose story is linked to Dante's life, the great florentine poet.
To spend unforgettable stays, very large spacious common areas, luxury and refined design in a perfect contrast between history and modernity. The apartment is on the first floor (2nd US floor) with view on the square and the church of San Pier Maggiore. The interior were recently renovated to grant you every possible comfort.
The house consists of 2 bedrooms, one with king bed, one with two single beds and one with double sofa bed; 3 bathrooms (2 complete with shower); a beautiful and vey well equipped kitchen, ideal for who loves to cook; and wide common areas as the living room and the studio.
There are many details that take us back to the history of this tower as the vaults of the ceiling and exposed stones on the walls, as many are the comforts as the access to internet with Wi-Fi and t

The neighborhood is quiet both for noise and for the car park.

description:
In a central area of Florence, few steps from Santa Maria Novella train station, Ariento 9 offer free WiFi, A/C and household amenities such as a coffee machine, a microwave and a fully equipped kitchen with a dishwasher.
Ariento 9 is at walking distance from the cathedral of Florence and Piazza della Signoria, close to museums, restaurants and supermarket.
