neighborhood_overview:
the bustling San Lorenzo neighborhood winds its way around the Central Market, selling local produce and street food. There are numerous shops selling leather clothing.
The Basilica of San Lorenzo houses the works of Donatello and the tombs of the Medici, a family from Florence from the Renaissance period. Also in the neighborhood is the Laurencian Medicea Library, designed by Michelangelo.
At sunset, the area's liveliness is home to wine bars, traditional pubs, and eclectic restaurants. Since the closing of the market, the area becomes pedestrianized.

name: lovely apartment in downtown
description:
Enjoy a vacation in style in this downtown space.
Elegant apartment, completely new, located in the center but in a quiet area.

neighborhood_overview:
The district, which takes its name from the famous Basilica San Marco in the center of the square, is among the most beautiful and most visited in Florence. The square was built in the mid-15th century to be able to build the church and the convent for the Silvetri monks. The San Marco district is mostly frequented by young people, as the central offices of the rectorate of the University of Florence reside here. Not far from the aforementioned park, there is another green area, the largest private garden in the historic center of Florence. Belonging to friar Durante Chiermontesi, it contained 3,488 exotic plants, oranges and lemons. His garden in the 18th century passed from an Italian style to an English one, with typical paths, bushes, trees and fountains. Palazzo Della Gherardesca is today a national artistic heritage. The Medici chapels have been a state museum since 1869, but their history is closely linked to that of the Church of San Lorenzo, to which they belong.
Medici C

The patio overlooks the Tuscan garden with 15x5 meter pool.  The lemon grove has a gym-equipped room; on-site parking is private and with an electric car charging station.
host_about: Ciao, sono Irene! Amo la vita immersa nel verde, gli animali, il buon vino e la bella gente. Adoro coltivare rapporti con le persone di tutte le culture e prendermi cura dei minimi particolari per poter rendere indimenticabile il soggiorno nella mia splendida città!

name: LeCure Large 2 Bedroom Apartment
description: This spacious and quiet apartment is the perfect choice for families and groups visiting Florence, for those who want to experience the beauties of Florence (Duomo and Ponte Vecchio 25-30 min walk), but prefer to stay out of the center, in one of the most evocative and peaceful residential areas of the city, the Le Cure neighborhood. Excellently connected to the center by bus, it has two bedrooms, large living area with two sofas and table, kitchen with balcony. Wifi and washing machine
host_about: Valter is interested in history, politics, environment, with a special passion for  Tuscany and Florence!

name: Florentine Spirit
description:
CIR 048017LTN9805
Charming and well equipped, the apartment is located in the heart of the Santo Spirito district. It has a bedroom with a double bed, a single bed on the mezzanine and a sofa bed in the living room, bathroom with shower and separate kitchenette. On the second floor without a lift (30 steps), the two-room apartment with high coffered ceilings is a welcoming and bright place, furnished in Florentine style to immerse yourself in the unique characteristics of a timeless city.
neighborhood_overview:
Santo Spirito square is a sort of outdoor lounge at any time of the day, it hosts a big market on Sundays which attracts people from all over the city, Florentines and tourists. Antiques, modern antiques, artisans, goldsmiths, restorers, local producers, this is the area where the Florentine spirit lives in front of the beautiful façade of Brunelleschi's Basilica.
The area is full of restaurants, wine bars, cafes, ice-cream parlors that offer refreshments, excellent food and good wine at the end of visits to the monuments that enrich the left bank of the Arno river: Palazzo Pitti, the Boboli Gardens, the Specola Museum, the Brancacci Chapel; just cross Ponte Vecchio to be in Piazza della Signoria and the Duomo.
All accessible on foot or via small electric buses that cross the streets of the center.
host_about: La curiosità è il motore che mi spinge verso nuove imprese e cambiamenti. Viaggi, persone, arte, natura, documentari sono alcune delle mie aree di azione.

name: Flowerence
description:
Hi, it's a pleasure to welcome you!
Located in a quiet residential setting, we have built this charming recently renovated apartment, located in the greenest neighborhood of the city. In addition to reaching the park in a few minutes by foot, you can get to downtown in just 10 minutes by tram.
neighborhood_overview:
The house is located in neighborhood 4 (no ZTL), a short walk to the Cascine Park, the "green lung" of our city.
Nearby you will find many useful services nearby: supermarkets, pharmacies, gyms, local shops, public gardens, bus stops and much more.
host_about:
Ciao,
sono Moira. Abito e vivo con la mia famiglia a Firenze da sempre. 
Amiamo viaggiare e ho colto questa opportunità per poter condividere con tutti voi la nostra stessa passione e il privilegio di poter conoscere e apprezzare tutti quegli aspetti della vita reale che attraverso il soggiorno in appartamento è possibile realizzare. 
Siete i benvenuti

name: Private room in shared flat.
description: Enjoy easy access to everything from this well- located apartment. 2km from the duomo, 1.3km from the Sant' ambrogio market. Enjoy walks along the river Arno and the proximity to all the amenities. Small double bedroom, with small double bed ( 140X190)  suitable for single travellers or couples. You'll be sharing the space with the owners David and his wife who are happy to offer some travel tips and help with any other requests. Full use of kitchen and garden. One cat (Mia) lives in the flat.
neighborhood_overview:
The Bellariva area is a lovely bustling friendly neighborhood. located just meters from the Arno river where you can enjoy relaxing walks. From spring to autumn the river bank comes alive with the opening of multiple venues which provide food, drinks and musical entertainment.
There are two Olympic sized swimming pools both within a ten minute walk should you wish to relax and cool off during the hotter months.

name: Cibe  Florence Apartment
description:
Apartment located in the Cure neighborhood, very close and well connected to Florence's historic center.
It is located on the first floor of an ancient former convent. Kitchen with a large table to eat comfortably in 4 people, mezzanine with two beds, double bedroom and bathroom with shower, is the space available for guests. The apartment is very quiet and recently renovated and recently renovated. It has everything you need to spend unforgettable moments in Florence
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is located in the Cure district, between the hill of Fiesole and the historic center of Florence. In the immediate vicinity of the house is the Area Pettini Park, a green area equipped with games for children. In the summer, the place where live music is played and a meeting point for young people. In the neighborhood square, excluding Sunday every morning, the typical fruit and vegetable market is held.
At Cure there are numerous shops and artisan shops and it is now the last authentically Florentine neighborhood.
My family and I live in the Care very close to the house.

name: Two cozy double rooms with Private Parking space
neighborhood_overview:
"San Frediano: Florence's Bohemian Quarter"

San Frediano is a captivating neighborhood in Florence, Italy, known for its bohemian charm and artistic vibe. Nestled on the Oltrarno (south of the Arno River) side of the city, it offers a refreshing escape from the tourist crowds while still being close to Florence's iconic attractions.

**Highlights:**
- **Artisan Workshops:** Explore narrow streets lined with artisan workshops, where you can watch skilled craftsmen at work on everything from leather goods to traditional Florentine paper.

- **Authentic Dining:** Savor authentic Tuscan cuisine at local trattorias and osterias. This neighborhood is a food lover's paradise, with options ranging from traditional dishes to modern fusion.

- **Local Art Scene:** San Frediano is home to many art studios and galleries, making it a hub for contemporary and traditional art. Be sure to visit the Clet Abraham Studio, known for its unique street art.

I speak English, german, a little of French. Love to explore nature either than towns and to discover local habit.

name: Streets of Florence in a room
description:
70sqm house with 2 bedrooms, kitchen, bathroom and entrance. Common spaces are at guests' complete disposal.
The house is' 5 minutes from the tram and '15 from the city center, a few steps from all essential amenities.

Below the house is a pastry shop for a 5-star breakfast and Stibbert and Fabbricotti parks.

In the room you will find works and art of the most active artists on the streets of Florence. A bookshelf full of art and architecture books.
host_about:
I’m 34 years old, i live in Florence where i was born in the late ‘80s. Italian by mother and Austrian by father, i had the luck to travel every year to Vienna to visit my family, therefor i speak German. After the early studies I’ve been around Europe For a decade: London, Oxford, Paris, Berlin, Vienna, Turin, Milano To finally get back home. In Florence I’ve opened the “GRAFFITI SHOP” of the town. Every day i work with Street Artists, Graffiti writers, tattooers and so on... a dream to me!
I speak English, german, a little of French. Love to explore nature either than towns and to discover local habit.

neighborhood_overview:
The bustling Rifredi neighborhood boasts several bars, Italian and ethnic restaurants, cinemas, theater, shops, shops, and supermarkets.

The neighborhood is well-served by public transportation. In Piazza Dalmatia there are tram stops and several bus lines.

name: Charming Suite "No Cucina"
description: You will be hosted in an elegant apartment recently renovated, quiet and full of light, comfortable and furnished with charm. It is located on the second and last floor of a building located in the prestigious and lively residential area of Via Gioberti, a few steps from the historic center of Florence. All the most important monuments of the city are within walking distance.
host_about:
My name is Claudia, I was born in Tuscany and i moved to Florence to study Art History. I immediately fell in love with this city and from that moment I never wanted to leave. I have lived and worked here for almost 30 years and i’m still astonished/amazed/ breathless by its beauty and history.I bought my apartment in via Fiesolana from an italian artist named Gabriele that used it as its studio, and the rooms still reflects the same disposition the artist needed to paint his works of art. It was love at first sight for me, from the moment i saw the apartment I realized it had to be mine. This apartment in via Fiesolana had been my home for many unforgettable years and I really hope that my guests could experience the same feelings of happiness i felt in this apartment. 
I am loving Florence but also the place where i was born: Monterotondo Marittimo, a small town  the high Maremma at 30 km from the sea.  My parent have a wonderful "colonica" with swimming pool immersed in the countryside and surrounded by greenery of Tuscany country. In the farmhouse I love spending my free time, both in summer and in winter, in total relaxation, in contact with nature. If you want to spend this wonderful experience the house is at your disposal.
